name: Center for Innovative Education
membership:
New Education Forum network is a platform sharing knowledge and making influence among political decision makers at the EU level. NEF themes for each year are different: Importance of Soft Skills and Vocational Education and Training, Inclusive Education, Smart Education in Smart Cities and Smart Regions, Digital Education and others. The above NEF topics combine with good practices of enhancing partnerships between companies, public administration and education and research sectors aiming at time reduction needed to train qualified employees and in the same time fulfilled and engaged citizens. 
Network is composed of the panelists who are actively engaged to deliver narrative part of the NEF meetings and networking.
goal:
Center for Innovative Education is working for education`s reforms through popularizing modern methods of learning in the scope of social, career and self-development of citizens. We do this through: (i) workshops, (ii) round tables, (iii) research, (iv) networking space, (v) internet platform and (vi) conferences (including annual organizing of the New Education Forum).

Our activities are dedicated to schools (especially teachers as mentors), employers, goernment run employment agencies, social care, decision makers, research and higher education institutions and organisations engaged in education projects from around the World.
Center for Innovative Education supports implementing global education and learning of soft skills like cooperation and communication capabilities, self-organization and responsibility for the teamwork at early stages of learning. Through such training young people are more aware of their social roles and are better prepared for entering the labor market and constitute preferable future employees. Taking to the account European Union’s high rate of youth unemployment this issue constitutes a crucial task to address. We strongly believe that solution to this problem lies with restructuring of education, which can be done through dedicated teachers and outside support of business and non-governmental organizations.

Innovative approach of the Center derives from nine years experience of collaboration with over 3.500 schools around Poland and abroad and patented education programs involving entrepreneurs and non-governmental organizations, which result in improving effectiveness of learning (i.e. teacher oriented “MENTOR” programs and students oriented “TALENT” programs).
interests: Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Youth
